## **17.3 Getting Started**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(tmap, SpatialAcc, sf, 
               ggstatsplot, reshape2,
               tidyverse)
```
:::


## **17.4 Geospatial Data Wrangling**

### **17.4.1 Importing geospatial data**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz <- st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", layer = "MP14_SUBZONE_NO_SEA_PL")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Reading layer `MP14_SUBZONE_NO_SEA_PL' from data source 
  `C:\Users\Kachel Lee\ka33rina\IS415GAA\Hands-on_Ex\Hands-on_Ex10\data\geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 323 features and 15 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 2667.538 ymin: 15748.72 xmax: 56396.44 ymax: 50256.33
Projected CRS: SVY21
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hexagons <- st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", layer = "hexagons") 
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Reading layer `hexagons' from data source 
  `C:\Users\Kachel Lee\ka33rina\IS415GAA\Hands-on_Ex\Hands-on_Ex10\data\geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 3125 features and 6 fields
Geometry type: POLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 2667.538 ymin: 21506.33 xmax: 50010.26 ymax: 50256.33
Projected CRS: SVY21 / Singapore TM
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
eldercare <- st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", layer = "ELDERCARE") 
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Reading layer `ELDERCARE' from data source 
  `C:\Users\Kachel Lee\ka33rina\IS415GAA\Hands-on_Ex\Hands-on_Ex10\data\geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 120 features and 19 fields
Geometry type: POINT
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 14481.92 ymin: 28218.43 xmax: 41665.14 ymax: 46804.9
Projected CRS: SVY21 / Singapore TM
```
:::
:::


### **17.4.2 Updating CRS information**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz <- st_transform(mpsz, 3414)
eldercare <- st_transform(eldercare, 3414)
hexagons <- st_transform(hexagons, 3414)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
st_crs(mpsz)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Coordinate Reference System:
  User input: EPSG:3414 
  wkt:
PROJCRS["SVY21 / Singapore TM",
    BASEGEOGCRS["SVY21",
        DATUM["SVY21",
            ELLIPSOID["WGS 84",6378137,298.257223563,
                LENGTHUNIT["metre",1]]],
        PRIMEM["Greenwich",0,
            ANGLEUNIT["degree",0.0174532925199433]],
        ID["EPSG",4757]],
    CONVERSION["Singapore Transverse Mercator",
        METHOD["Transverse Mercator",
            ID["EPSG",9807]],
        PARAMETER["Latitude of natural origin",1.36666666666667,
            ANGLEUNIT["degree",0.0174532925199433],
            ID["EPSG",8801]],
        PARAMETER["Longitude of natural origin",103.833333333333,
            ANGLEUNIT["degree",0.0174532925199433],
            ID["EPSG",8802]],
        PARAMETER["Scale factor at natural origin",1,
            SCALEUNIT["unity",1],
            ID["EPSG",8805]],
        PARAMETER["False easting",28001.642,
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1],
            ID["EPSG",8806]],
        PARAMETER["False northing",38744.572,
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1],
            ID["EPSG",8807]]],
    CS[Cartesian,2],
        AXIS["northing (N)",north,
            ORDER[1],
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1]],
        AXIS["easting (E)",east,
            ORDER[2],
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1]],
    USAGE[
        SCOPE["Cadastre, engineering survey, topographic mapping."],
        AREA["Singapore - onshore and offshore."],
        BBOX[1.13,103.59,1.47,104.07]],
    ID["EPSG",3414]]
```
:::
:::


### **17.4.3 Cleaning and updating attribute fields of the geospatial data**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
eldercare <- eldercare %>%
  dplyr::select(fid, ADDRESSPOS) %>%
  mutate(capacity = 100)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hexagons <- hexagons %>%
  dplyr::select(fid) %>%
  mutate(demand = 100)
```
:::


## **17.5 Apsaital Data Handling and Wrangling**

### **17.5.1 Importing Distance Matrix**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ODMatrix <- read_csv("data/aspatial/OD_Matrix.csv", skip = 0)
```
:::


### **17.5.2 Tidying distance matrix**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
distmat <- ODMatrix %>%
  dplyr::select(origin_id, destination_id, total_cost) %>%
  spread(destination_id, total_cost)%>%
  dplyr::select(c(-c('origin_id')))
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
distmat_km <- as.matrix(distmat/1000)
```
:::


## **17.6 Modelling and Visualising Accessibility using Hansen Method**

### **17.6.1 Computing Hansen’s accessibility**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
acc_Hansen <- data.frame(ac(hexagons$demand,
                            eldercare$capacity,
                            distmat_km, 
                            #d0 = 50,
                            power = 2, 
                            family = "Hansen"))
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
colnames(acc_Hansen) <- "accHansen"
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
acc_Hansen <- tbl_df(acc_Hansen)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hexagon_Hansen <- bind_cols(hexagons, acc_Hansen)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
acc_Hansen <- data.frame(ac(hexagons$demand,
                            eldercare$capacity,
                            distmat_km, 
                            #d0 = 50,
                            power = 0.5, 
                            family = "Hansen"))

colnames(acc_Hansen) <- "accHansen"
acc_Hansen <- tbl_df(acc_Hansen)
hexagon_Hansen <- bind_cols(hexagons, acc_Hansen)
```
:::


### **17.6.2 Visualising Hansen’s accessibility**

#### 17.6.2.1 Extracting map extend


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mapex <- st_bbox(hexagons)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tmap_mode("plot")
tm_shape(hexagon_Hansen,
         bbox = mapex) + 
  tm_fill(col = "accHansen",
          n = 10,
          style = "quantile",
          border.col = "black",
          border.lwd = 1) +
tm_shape(eldercare) +
  tm_symbols(size = 0.1) +
  tm_layout(main.title = "Accessibility to eldercare: Hansen method",
            main.title.position = "center",
            main.title.size = 2,
            legend.outside = FALSE,
            legend.height = 0.45, 
            legend.width = 3.0,
            legend.format = list(digits = 6),
            legend.position = c("right", "top"),
            frame = TRUE) +
  tm_compass(type="8star", size = 2) +
  tm_scale_bar(width = 0.15) +
  tm_grid(lwd = 0.1, alpha = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex10_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-18-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### **17.6.3 Statistical graphic visualisation**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hexagon_Hansen <- st_join(hexagon_Hansen, mpsz, 
                          join = st_intersects)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=hexagon_Hansen, 
       aes(y = log(accHansen), 
           x= REGION_N)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_point(stat="summary", 
             fun.y="mean", 
             colour ="red", 
             size=2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex10_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-20-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## **17.7 Modelling and Visualising Accessibility using KD2SFCA Method**

### **17.7.1 Computing KD2SFCA’s accessibility**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
acc_KD2SFCA <- data.frame(ac(hexagons$demand,
                            eldercare$capacity,
                            distmat_km, 
                            d0 = 50,
                            power = 2, 
                            family = "KD2SFCA"))

colnames(acc_KD2SFCA) <- "accKD2SFCA"
acc_KD2SFCA <- tbl_df(acc_KD2SFCA)
hexagon_KD2SFCA <- bind_cols(hexagons, acc_KD2SFCA)
```
:::


### **17.7.2 Visualising KD2SFCA’s accessibility**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tmap_mode("plot")
tm_shape(hexagon_KD2SFCA,
         bbox = mapex) + 
  tm_fill(col = "accKD2SFCA",
          n = 10,
          style = "quantile",
          border.col = "black",
          border.lwd = 1) +
tm_shape(eldercare) +
  tm_symbols(size = 0.1) +
  tm_layout(main.title = "Accessibility to eldercare: KD2SFCA method",
            main.title.position = "center",
            main.title.size = 2,
            legend.outside = FALSE,
            legend.height = 0.45, 
            legend.width = 3.0,
            legend.format = list(digits = 6),
            legend.position = c("right", "top"),
            frame = TRUE) +
  tm_compass(type="8star", size = 2) +
  tm_scale_bar(width = 0.15) +
  tm_grid(lwd = 0.1, alpha = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex10_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-22-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### **17.7.3 Statistical graphic visualisation**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hexagon_KD2SFCA <- st_join(hexagon_KD2SFCA, mpsz, 
                          join = st_intersects)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=hexagon_KD2SFCA, 
       aes(y = accKD2SFCA, 
           x= REGION_N)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_point(stat="summary", 
             fun.y="mean", 
             colour ="red", 
             size=2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex10_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-24-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## **17.8 Modelling and Visualising Accessibility using Spatial Accessibility Measure (SAM) Method**

### **17.8.1 Computing SAM accessibility**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
acc_SAM <- data.frame(ac(hexagons$demand,
                         eldercare$capacity,
                         distmat_km, 
                         d0 = 50,
                         power = 2, 
                         family = "SAM"))

colnames(acc_SAM) <- "accSAM"
acc_SAM <- tbl_df(acc_SAM)
hexagon_SAM <- bind_cols(hexagons, acc_SAM)
```
:::


### **17.8.2 Visualising SAM’s accessibility**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tmap_mode("plot")
tm_shape(hexagon_SAM,
         bbox = mapex) + 
  tm_fill(col = "accSAM",
          n = 10,
          style = "quantile",
          border.col = "black",
          border.lwd = 1) +
tm_shape(eldercare) +
  tm_symbols(size = 0.1) +
  tm_layout(main.title = "Accessibility to eldercare: SAM method",
            main.title.position = "center",
            main.title.size = 2,
            legend.outside = FALSE,
            legend.height = 0.45, 
            legend.width = 3.0,
            legend.format = list(digits = 3),
            legend.position = c("right", "top"),
            frame = TRUE) +
  tm_compass(type="8star", size = 2) +
  tm_scale_bar(width = 0.15) +
  tm_grid(lwd = 0.1, alpha = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex10_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-26-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### **17.8.3 Statistical graphic visualisation**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hexagon_SAM <- st_join(hexagon_SAM, mpsz, 
                       join = st_intersects)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=hexagon_SAM, 
       aes(y = accSAM, 
           x= REGION_N)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_point(stat="summary", 
             fun.y="mean", 
             colour ="red", 
             size=2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex10_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-28-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
